intro: Draba brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited rockcress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–20 centimeters, with basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters, often blooming in early spring. Draba brachycarpa is characterized by its short, thickened fruiting stems and is adapted to survive in harsh, cold climates.
